page.title: 18Farming.
page.content: Following the drainage of the land around Newport at the end of the 1780's,the farming changed from pastural to arable. The soil is mainly a heavy clay with small areas of lighter silt soil.The main crops grown are barley and wheat.There are also several grass fields,that have proved too wet to cultivate cereals.On these grass fields,cattle and sheep are reared. A new development to have emerged in the last few years is the amount of land in the area being used for market gardening.Many hectares are now growing lettuce, celery, carrots, tomatoes and other vegetables. There is a daily collection of produce by large lorries for distribution to a large chain of super markets.
